verses.kjv: And this is the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow them, to minister unto me in the priest’s office: Take one young bullock, and two rams without blemish,
verses.ct: Here is what you must do to set them apart as holy so they can serve me as priests: Get 1 young bull and 2 rams that have no defects.

verses.kjv: And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: of wheaten flour shalt thou make them.
verses.ct: Also prepare bread made without yeast, flat cakes made without yeast and mixed with oil, and thin wafers made without yeast and coated with oil. Make all of these from fine wheat flour.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
verses.ct: Place them all in a single basket and bring them in the basket along with the bull and the 2 rams.

verses.kjv: And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.
verses.ct: Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the curious girdle of the ephod:
verses.ct: Then take the priestly clothing and dress Aaron in the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod itself, and the breastpiece. Fasten the skillfully woven sash of the ephod around him.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put the mitre upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre.
verses.ct: Place the turban on his head and attach the sacred crown to the turban.

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour it upon his head, and anoint him.
verses.ct: Then take the anointing oil, pour it over his head, and anoint him.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.
verses.ct: Next, bring his sons forward and dress them in their tunics.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt gird them with girdles, Aaron and his sons, and put the bonnets on them: and the priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.
verses.ct: Tie sashes around Aaron and his sons, and put headbands on them. The priesthood will belong to them as a permanent regulation. In this way you will ordain Aaron and his sons.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.
verses.ct: Bring the bull to the front of the tent of meeting, and have Aaron and his sons place their hands on the bull's head.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt kill the bullock before the LORD, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.ct: Slaughter the bull in the LORD's presence at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.
verses.ct: Take some of the bull's blood and apply it with your finger to the horns of the altar, then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul that is above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and burn them upon the altar.
verses.ct: Take all the fat surrounding the internal organs, the lobe attached to the liver, both kidneys along with the fat on them, and burn all of it on the altar.

verses.kjv: But the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, shalt thou burn with fire without the camp: it is a sin offering.
verses.ct: But the bull's meat, hide, and waste you must burn outside the camp. This is a sin offering.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt also take one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
verses.ct: Then take 1 of the rams, and have Aaron and his sons place their hands on the ram's head.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take his blood, and sprinkle it round about upon the altar.
verses.ct: Slaughter the ram, collect its blood, and splash it on all sides of the altar.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him, and his legs, and put them unto his pieces, and unto his head.
verses.ct: Cut the ram into sections, wash its internal organs and legs, and arrange them with the other pieces and the head.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt offering unto the LORD: it is a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Burn the entire ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the LORD, a pleasing aroma, a fire offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
verses.ct: Then take the second ram, and have Aaron and his sons place their hands on the ram's head.

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
verses.ct: Slaughter the ram, take some of its blood, and apply it to the right earlobe of Aaron, the right earlobe of each of his sons, the thumb of their right hand, and the big toe of their right foot. Then splash the remaining blood on all sides of the altar.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons’ garments with him.
verses.ct: Take some of the blood from the altar along with some of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and his clothing, and on his sons and their clothing. This will set him apart as holy — him and his clothing, along with his sons and their clothing.

verses.kjv: Also thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder; for it is a ram of consecration:
verses.ct: From this ram, remove the fat, the fat tail, the fat covering the internal organs, the lobe attached to the liver, both kidneys with the fat on them, and the right thigh — since this is the ram of ordination.

verses.kjv: And one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the LORD:
verses.ct: Also take 1 round loaf of bread, 1 cake made with oil, and 1 wafer from the basket of bread made without yeast that is in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put all in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons; and shalt wave them for a wave offering before the LORD.
verses.ct: Place all of these in the hands of Aaron and his sons, and have them lift and wave them as a wave offering in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt receive them of their hands, and burn them upon the altar for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour before the LORD: it is an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Then take them from their hands and burn them on the altar along with the burnt offering, as a pleasing aroma in the LORD's presence. It is a fire offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s consecration, and wave it for a wave offering before the LORD: and it shall be thy part.
verses.ct: Take the breast from the ram used for Aaron's ordination and wave it as a wave offering in the LORD's presence. This portion will be yours.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:
verses.ct: Set apart as holy the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the raised offering — both the portion that was waved and the portion that was raised up — from the ram of ordination, belonging to Aaron and his sons.

verses.kjv: And it shall be Aaron’s and his sons’ by a statute for ever from the children of Israel: for it is an heave offering: and it shall be an heave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifice of their peace offerings, even their heave offering unto the LORD.
verses.ct: This will be a permanent share for Aaron and his sons from the people of Israel. It is a raised offering, and it will be the raised offering that the people of Israel give from their peace offerings — their raised offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated in them.
verses.ct: Aaron's sacred clothing will be passed down to his descendants after him, so they can be anointed and ordained while wearing them.

verses.kjv: And that son that is priest in his stead shall put them on seven days, when he cometh into the tabernacle of the congregation to minister in the holy place.
verses.ct: Whichever son succeeds him as priest must wear these garments for 7 days when he enters the tent of meeting to serve in the holy place.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.
verses.ct: Take the ram of ordination and boil its meat in the holy place.

verses.kjv: And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.ct: Aaron and his sons are to eat the ram's meat and the bread from the basket at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And they shall eat those things wherewith the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat thereof, because they are holy.
verses.ct: They must eat these items that were used to make atonement during their ordination and consecration. No outsider may eat any of it, because it is holy.

verses.kjv: And if ought of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verses.ct: If any of the ordination meat or bread is left over until morning, burn what remains. It must not be eaten, because it is holy.

verses.kjv: And thus shalt thou do unto Aaron, and to his sons, according to all things which I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.
verses.ct: Carry out everything I have commanded you for Aaron and his sons in exactly this way. The ordination process will take 7 days.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt offer every day a bullock for a sin offering for atonement: and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou hast made an atonement for it, and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctify it.
verses.ct: Each day, offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement. Purify the altar by making atonement for it, and anoint it to set it apart as holy.

verses.kjv: Seven days thou shalt make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoever toucheth the altar shall be holy.
verses.ct: For 7 days, make atonement for the altar and set it apart as holy. The altar will become most holy — anything that touches it will become holy.

verses.kjv: Now this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year day by day continually.
verses.ct: Here is what you are to offer on the altar regularly: 2 year-old lambs every single day.

verses.kjv: The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even:
verses.ct: Offer 1 lamb in the morning and the other lamb at twilight.

verses.kjv: And with the one lamb a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil; and the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering.
verses.ct: With the first lamb, include a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a quarter hin of pressed olive oil, and a quarter hin of wine as a drink offering.

verses.kjv: And the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, and shalt do thereto according to the meat offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Offer the second lamb at twilight with the same grain offering and drink offering as the morning sacrifice, as a pleasing aroma, a fire offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: This shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD: where I will meet you, to speak there unto thee.
verses.ct: This regular burnt offering must continue through all your generations at the entrance of the tent of meeting in the LORD's presence. That is where I will meet with you and speak to you.

verses.kjv: And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle shall be sanctified by my glory.
verses.ct: There I will meet with the people of Israel, and the place will be made holy by my glory.

verses.kjv: And I will sanctify the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar: I will sanctify also both Aaron and his sons, to minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: I will make the tent of meeting and the altar holy. I will also set apart Aaron and his sons to serve me as priests.

verses.kjv: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.
verses.ct: I will live among the people of Israel and be their God.

verses.kjv: And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them: I am the LORD their God.
verses.ct: They will recognize that I am the LORD their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt so that I could live among them. I am the LORD their God.
